inclusion.criterion: stable symptoms of COPD in the previous 3 months before study entry
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) after bronchodilation with 400 mcg salbutamol that was 25 to 90% of predicted
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: a change of less than 20% of predicted FEV1, 30 minutes following bronchodilation
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: a FEV1/forced vital capacity (FVC) of less than 75%
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: history of at least 10 pack-years of smoking or prolonged exposure (>10 years) to noxious gases
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: He doesn't smoke or use illicit drugs.

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: He currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg, one puff twice daily.

notes: A 39-year-old man with a history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness. Symptoms improve within 1-2 hours outside the workplace.
